definition: to cut off/to chop sth in half
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Sometimes we have to do things which are painful, to make our lives better.
sentences.chinese: 有時候必須慧劍斬斷情思，才能更好的生活。

sentences.english: And the people shall be as ashes after a fire, as a bundle of thorns they shall be burnt with fire.
sentences.chinese: 萬民將被焚燒，有如石灰，又如斬斷的荊棘毀於火中。

sentences.english: We must take concerted action and cut his claws .
sentences.chinese: 我們必須齊心合力，斬斷他的魔爪。

sentences.english: But it's a Gordian knot, my dear, and it will have to be cut.
sentences.chinese: 但這是個很難解的結，親愛的，你得一刀斬斷它。

definition: to peel/to strip/to peel off/to come off (of tissue, skin, covering etc)
to bring to a conclusion/to settle (a dispute)/to do away with (oneself)/to break off (a relationship)/resolution (of a problem)
to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
